graphics

Class Circle

  • Object
    • graphics.Shape
      • graphics.Circle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable

    public class Circle
extends Shape
    A shape of a circle that can be animated in its Panel2D parentPanel.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class graphics.Shape

        colorsIndex, parentPanel, pixelsIndex

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle(int x, int y, int radius, int pixelsIndex, int colorsIndex)
      Creates an instance of a circle to animate.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw()
      Move, and then draw this circle shape in its parentPanel.

      • Methods inherited from class graphics.Shape

        setParent

      • Methods inherited from class Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Circle

        public Circle(int x,
              int y,
              int radius,
              int pixelsIndex,
              int colorsIndex)
        Creates an instance of a circle to animate. It is set for default diagonal motion.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal centre of this circle.
        y - The vertical centre of this circle.
        radius - The radius of this circle.
        pixelsIndex - The index of the character used to draw the circle.
        colorsIndex - The index of the colour used to draw the circle.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Move, and then draw this circle shape in its parentPanel. This is Bresenham's Circle-Drawing Algorithm, which you can read a short explanation about at the website GeeksForGeeks.
